categorizer module¶

This module is responsible for extra data cleaning for hypothesis 2, which involves transforming the date into a year and adding a category for each crime.

Functions¶

date_to_year(df, column)

Takes the column of the dataframe in the format “XX/XX/XXXX 00:00:00 XM” and returns only the year.

aux_category(code, crimes)

Auxiliary function that, given a crime code, returns its category.

category(df)

Function responsible for adding the ‘category’ column to the dataframe.

Examples

>>> import categorizer as ctg
>>> df_dated = ctg.date_to_year(df, 'Date')
>>> crime_type = ctg.aux_category(2, crimes)
>>> ctg.category(df)
src.hypothesis_two.categorizer.aux_category(cod: int, crimes: dict = {'Assaults': [230, 231, 235, 236, 245, 250, 251, 354, 626, 668, 761, 860, 926], 'Burglary': [310, 320, 812], 'Car Theft': [330, 331, 410, 420, 421, 433, 510, 520, 624, 625, 946], 'Disappearance': [627, 940], 'Homicides': [110, 113], 'Personal Theft': [350, 351, 352, 353, 450, 451, 452, 453], 'Possession of Weapons or Drugs': [745, 753, 886], 'Property Theft': [341, 343, 345, 440, 441, 442, 443, 444, 445, 470, 471, 472, 473, 474, 475, 480, 485, 487, 491, 649, 662, 740, 946], 'Rape': [121, 122, 237, 815, 820, 821, 890], 'Robbery': [210, 220, 850], 'Traffic Incidents': [901, 903, 956]}) → str¶

Returns the crime type based on the code.

Parameters:

  • code (int) – Crime code.

  • crimes (dict) – Dictionary with crime categorization (by default, the one provided by the dataset).

Returns:

Name of the category according to the crime, or ‘Others’ if not in the dictionary.

Return type:

str

Example

>>> crimes = { 'Robbery': [1, 2], 'Homicide': [3, 4]}
>>> crime_type = aux_category(2, crimes)
>>> print(crime_type)
Robbery
>>> crime_type = aux_category(4, crimes)
>>> print(crime_type)
Homicide
>>> crime_type = aux_category(5, crimes)
>>> print(crime_type)
Others
src.hypothesis_two.categorizer.category(df: DataFrame, column: str) → DataFrame¶

Function responsible for creating the ‘category’ column, using the auxiliary function aux_category for each row.

Parameters:

  • df (pd.DataFrame) – DataFrame with the specified column from which the function will create the new column.

  • column (str) – Name of the column containing the codes.

Returns:

DataFrame with an additional ‘category’ column.

Return type:

pd.DataFrame

Example

>>> df = pd.DataFrame({'victim': ['A', 'B'], 'codes': [100, 745]})
>>> df_with_category = category(df, 'codes')
  victim  codes                        category
0      A    100                          Others
1      B    745  Possession of Weapons or Drugs
src.hypothesis_two.categorizer.date_to_year(df: DataFrame, column: str) → DataFrame¶

Extracts the day, month, and year from a column in the format “dd/mm/yyyy 00:00:00 XM”.

Parameters:

  • df (pd.DataFrame) – DataFrame with a column in the format “dd/mm/yyyy 00:00:00 XM”.

  • column (str) – Name of the column with this format.

Returns:

DataFrame without the passed column, but with 3 new ones: ‘day’, ‘month’, and ‘year’.

Return type:

pd.DataFrame

Example

>>> df = pd.DataFrame({'Date': ['26/11/2004 08:00:00 PM', '10/10/2024 07:00:00 AM']})
>>> df_clean = date_to_year(df, 'Date')
>>> print(df_clean)
    day  month  year
0   26      11  2004
1   10      10  2024
